name: AXXX - West Dapto - ITC 008 (ITP008) - Kerbs and Gutters
template name: AXXX - West Dapto - ITC 008 (ITP008) - Kerbs and Gutters

name: REQUIREMENTS / REFERENCE: Project Safety Plan, Project Environment Plan
• All site personnel inducted, required SWMS completed and signed, Safety Plan approved
• ERSED controls installed on site, air quality visually monitored for dust etc due to construction activities, Environment Plan approved
• Contact DBYD and complete excavation permit, extent of works set out with survey pegs
• Confirm concrete mix design is acceptable for use with Client
• 20 MPa concrete mix (28 day strength) as per WCC 7000 C10
• WITNESS POINT: Client inspection of set-out of any sawcutting to existing kerbs and gutters, footpaths, driveways, road pavements
• HOLD POINT: Details of procedures and / or devices for temporary drainage arrangements while the works are taking place
• WITNESS POINT: Client inspection of prepared foundation / base of future kerb and gutter, shaped and compacted
• WITNESS POINT: Confirm location(s) of any driveway crossovers in kerbs, gutters and channels (if required)
• WITNESS POINT: Reconnect and extend existing property stormwater outlets through to the new kerb and / or gutter (if required)
• HOLD POINT: Certification of completed formwork conformance (if required)
• WITNESS POINT: Client inspection of completed formwork
• WITNESS POINT: Client inspection of installed steel reinforcement including cores, fixings and embedded items fixed in place (if required)

• WITNESS POINT: Construct a 3m trial section to the documented level of finish to show capability of the forming equipment and request Client inspection. Subject to approval, incorporate the trial section into the completed works
• Confirm weather is suitable for pouring concrete
• Complete concrete testing and keep pour records, if required
• Protect finished concrete and cure as needed
• Strip kerb and gutter works once concrete has achieved suitable strength
• Backfill stripped works as specified in drawings
• WITNESS POINT: Client inspection of completed backfill placed behind kerb and gutters
• WITNESS POINT: Reinstate any damage to footpaths, road pavement and services in the event of their damage during the works (if required)
QA ENGINEER / SPE / PE SIGN OFF
